      • processSpriteModeSwitch

        public void processSpriteModeSwitch()
        One of the methods responsible for modifying element positions depending on using animated sprites or not. Using animated sprites requires lowering some elements down the screen and modifying sizes.
        See Also:
        AddPokemonController.processSpriteModeSwitch(), SummaryController.processSpriteModeSwitch()

      • resetState

        public void resetState()
        Resets screen to default state.

      • getVolume

        public float getVolume(javax.sound.sampled.Clip clip)
        Method for checking volume. Converts Clip's logarithmic audio volume controls to a linear scale,between 0 and 1, for ease of use.
        Parameters:
        clip - Clip whose volume should be checked
        Returns:
        volume, in values between 0 and 1

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(javax.sound.sampled.Clip clip,
                      float volume)
        Method responsible for changing volume. Converts Clip's logarithmic audio volume controls to a linear scale, between 0 and 1, for ease of use.
        Parameters:
        clip - Clip whose volume should be changed
        volume - value of volume, between 0 and 1

        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException

      • prepareHitEffect

        private java.io.InputStream prepareHitEffect(float typeEffect)
        Method which prepares the sound effect that should be played during hit animation.
        Parameters:
        typeEffect - type effectiveness of used move
        Returns:
        InputStream of requested sound effect
        See Also:
        BattleLogic.calculateTypeEffect(Move, Type, Type)

        Returns:

      • prepareEffectClip

        private void prepareEffectClip(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
                        throws javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException,
                               java.io.IOException,
                               javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Method which loads requested sound effect into the audioEffectsClip variable. This is the final preparation before playing back the sound.

        public void switchToPlayerChoice(boolean choice)

        Parameters:

      • wipeText

        public javafx.animation.Timeline wipeText(boolean inTimeline)
        Method used to signal when text should be wiped. Wipes text from both the full text display and the small text display, known in code as battleText and battleTextFull.
        Parameters:
        inTimeline - if true only returns text wipe action as Timeline, otherwise wipes text as soon as the method is called
        Returns:
        Timeline object containing the action of text wipe

      • getBattleText

        public javafx.animation.Timeline getBattleText(java.lang.String text,
                                               boolean full)
        Method called to put text into the textbox. All text appears as soon as the Timeline is played.
        Parameters:
        text - String containing the text that should appear
        full - if true display text on battleTextFull, otherwise displays on battleText
        Returns:
        Timeline object containing the action of filling screen with text
        See Also:
        getBattleTextAnimation(String, boolean)

      • getBattleTextAnimation

        public javafx.animation.Timeline getBattleTextAnimation(java.lang.String text,
                                                        boolean full)
        Method called to put text into a textbox. Text appears letter by letter at a fixed speed. It can be sped up when turbo mode is active.
        Parameters:
        text - String containing the text that should appear
        full - if true display text on battleTextFull, otherwise displays on battleText
        Returns:
        Timeline object containing the animation of filling screen with text letter by letter
        See Also:
        getBattleText(String, boolean)

                                 javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Shifts the colors displayed on an ImageView to the specified color.
